Stage Results A RallyDataJunkie Adventure Preface Who This Review Is For

Stage Results A RallyDataJunkie Adventure Tony Hirst Last generated on 17 October, 2021 Preface Automatically generated stage timing and results for stages on WRC RallyRACC Rally de España, 2021. Based on analysis of timing and results data downloaded from the WRC website. To discuss / critique / comment on these analyses, please use the discussion forum. For a guide to the code used to generate the stage reports, see Visualising WRC Rally Results. See also Visualising WRC Rally Stages. This report is unofficial and is not associated in any way with the Fédération Internationale de l’Automobile (FIA) or WRC Promoter GmbH. Who This Review Is For The RallyDataJunkie project, such as it is, is a personal exploration of various ways of representing and visualising rally related stage, timing and results data. There are several potential audiences: rally fans, looking for summaries of rally events; teams and crews, looking for variously arranged summaries to check and compare performances; commentators and journalists, looking for variously arranged summaries and overviews as a tool for confirming or identifying storypoints; data folk, looking for various ways of representing various route, timing or results data.

the stage winner. 1.1.6 Ultimate Stage Comparisons Split time comparisons relative to various ultimate stage time calculations. These views provide various ways of comparing the performance of each driver to various ghost drivers: best recorded split time at each split (ultimate actuals): gives an estimate of how well the driver’s split times compare with each first ranked split time (time into stage at each split); fastest time going from one split to the next (ultimate sections): gives an estimate of how quickly each comparisons relative to various ultimate stage time calculations. These views provide various ways of comparing the performance of each driver to various ghost drivers: best recorded split time at each split (ultimate actuals): gives an estimate of how well the driver’s split times compare with each first ranked split time (time into stage at each split); fastest time going from one split to the next (ultimate sections): gives an estimate of how quickly each driver completed each split section relative to the quickest time recorded completing that split section (time taken to go from one split point to the next); accumulated ultimate sections times: gives and estimate of how quickly the driver is going relative to the fastest possible completion of the stage based on accumulated ultimate split section times. 2.1.6.1 Ultimate Actuals Driver times These views provide various ways of comparing the performance of each driver to various ghost drivers: best recorded split time at each split (ultimate actuals): gives an estimate of how well the driver’s split times compare with each first ranked split time (time into stage at each split); fastest time going from one split to the next (ultimate sections): gives an estimate of how quickly each driver completed each split section relative to the quickest time recorded completing that split section (time taken to go from one split point to the next); accumulated ultimate sections times: gives These views provide various ways of comparing the performance of each driver to various ghost drivers: best recorded split time at each split (ultimate actuals): gives an estimate of how well the driver’s split times compare with each first ranked split time (time into stage at each split); fastest time going from one split to the next (ultimate sections): gives an estimate of how quickly each driver completed each split section relative to the quickest time recorded completing that split section (time taken to go from one split point to the next); accumulated ultimate sections times: gives and estimate of how quickly the driver is going relative to the fastest possible completion of the stage based on accumulated ultimate split section times. 4.1.6.1 Ultimate Actuals Driver times EVA took second position on stage, 0.3s behind stage winner NEU in a time of 617.9s and retained the overall lead, just 0.3s further behind NEU. OGI was in third position on stage, with a time of 620.9s . ROV took fourth position on stage, 5.2s behind NEU . SOR took fifth on stage, with a time of 623.4s, just 0.6s off ROV. FOU was in sixth on stage, 4.5s behind SOR and moved up one place to sixth overall. GRE took seventh on stage, 11.4s behind the stage winner in a time of 629.0s and moved up one place to seventh overall. SOL was in eighth place on stage, 9.5s behind GRE and moved up one place to eighth overall. SLN was in ninth on stage, 26.8s behind the stage winner in a time of 644.4s and moved up one place to ninth overall. 4.3 Driver Report, SS4 - OGI OGI was in third position on stage, with a time of 620.9s . These views provide various ways of comparing the performance of each driver to various ghost drivers: best recorded split time at each split (ultimate actuals): gives an estimate of how well the driver’s split times compare with each first ranked split time (time into stage at each split); fastest time going from one split to the next (ultimate sections): gives an estimate of how quickly each driver completed each split section relative to the quickest time recorded completing that split section (time taken to go from one split point to the next); accumulated ultimate sections times: gives and estimate of how quickly the driver is going relative to the fastest possible completion of the stage based on accumulated ultimate split section times. 5.1.6.1 Ultimate Actuals Driver times These views provide various ways of comparing the performance of each driver to various ghost drivers: best recorded split time at each split (ultimate actuals): gives an estimate of how well the driver’s split times compare with each first ranked split time (time into stage at each split); fastest time going from one split to the next (ultimate sections): gives an estimate of how quickly each driver completed each split section relative to the quickest time recorded completing that split section (time taken to go from one split point to the next); accumulated ultimate sections times: gives and estimate of how quickly the driver is going relative to the fastest possible completion of the stage based on accumulated ultimate split section times. 6.1.6.1 Ultimate Actuals Driver times These views provide various ways of comparing the performance of each driver to various ghost drivers: best recorded split time at each split (ultimate actuals): gives an estimate of how well the driver’s split times compare with each first ranked split time (time into stage at each split); fastest time going from one split to the next (ultimate sections): gives an estimate of how quickly each driver completed each split section relative to the quickest time recorded completing that split section (time taken to go from one split point to the next); accumulated ultimate sections times: gives and estimate of how quickly the driver is going relative to the fastest possible completion of the stage based on accumulated ultimate split section times. 7.1.6.1 Ultimate Actuals Driver times These views provide various ways of comparing the performance of each driver to various ghost drivers: best recorded split time at each split (ultimate actuals): gives an estimate of how well the driver’s split times compare with each first ranked split time (time into stage at each split); fastest time going from one split to the next (ultimate sections): gives an estimate of how quickly each driver completed each split section relative to the quickest time recorded completing that split section (time taken to go from one split point to the next); accumulated ultimate sections times: gives and estimate of how quickly the driver is going relative to the fastest possible completion of the stage based on accumulated ultimate split section times. 8.1.6.1 Ultimate Actuals Driver times Ultimate Stage Comparisons Split time comparisons relative to various ultimate stage time calculations. These views provide various ways of comparing the performance of each driver to various ghost drivers: best recorded split time at each split (ultimate actuals): gives an estimate of how well the driver’s split times compare with each first ranked split time (time into stage at each split); fastest time going from one split to the next (ultimate sections): gives an estimate of how quickly each driver completed each split section relative to the quickest time recorded completing that split section (time taken to go from one split point to the next); accumulated ultimate sections times: gives and estimate of how quickly the driver is going relative to the fastest possible completion of the stage based on accumulated ultimate split section times. 9.1.6.1 Ultimate Actuals Driver times recorded the stage win and kept hold of the overall lead recording a time of 723.5s. SOR took second position on stage, with a time of 723.8s, just 0.3s off NEU. EVA was in third on stage, 2.0s further back behind SOR . OGI took fourth on stage, with a time of 729.8s . SLN was in eighth place on stage, with a time of 738.9s and moved up one place to eighth overall. SOL took ninth place on stage, 19.2s behind stage winner NEU in a time of 742.7s and moved up one place to seventh overall. GRE was in twenty-sixth position on stage, with a time of 805.4s dropped two places to ninth overall. 9.3 Driver Report, SS9 - OGI OGI took fourth on stage, with a time of 729.8s . These views provide various ways of comparing the performance of each driver to various ghost drivers: best recorded split time at each split (ultimate actuals): gives an estimate of how well the driver’s split times compare with each first ranked split time (time into stage at each split); fastest time going from one split to the next (ultimate sections): gives an estimate of how quickly each driver completed each split section relative to the quickest time recorded completing that split section (time taken to go from one split point to the next); accumulated ultimate sections times: gives and estimate of how quickly the driver is going relative to the fastest possible completion of the stage based on accumulated ultimate split section times. 10.1.6.1 Ultimate Actuals Driver times relative to various ultimate stage time calculations. These views provide various ways of comparing the performance of each driver to various ghost drivers: best recorded split time at each split (ultimate actuals): gives an estimate of how well the driver’s split times compare with each first ranked split time (time into stage at each split); fastest time going from one split to the next (ultimate sections): gives an estimate of how quickly each driver completed each split section relative to the quickest time recorded completing that split section (time taken to go from one split point to the next); accumulated ultimate sections times: gives and estimate of how quickly the driver is going relative to the fastest possible completion of the stage based on accumulated ultimate split section times. 11.1.6.1 Ultimate Actuals Driver times Ultimate Stage Comparisons Split time comparisons relative to various ultimate stage time calculations. These views provide various ways of comparing the performance of each driver to various ghost drivers: best recorded split time at each split (ultimate actuals): gives an estimate of how well the driver’s split times compare with each first ranked split time (time into stage at each split); fastest time going from one split to the next (ultimate sections): gives an estimate of how quickly each driver completed each split section relative to the quickest time recorded completing that split section (time taken to go from one split point to the next); accumulated ultimate sections times: gives and estimate of how quickly the driver is going relative to the fastest possible completion of the stage based on accumulated ultimate split section times. 12.1.6.1 Ultimate Actuals Driver times NA NA GRE Stage report for SS12: OGI recorded the stage win and in a time of 723.7s. NEU took second on stage, with a time of 724.9s and retained the overall lead of the rally. SOR took third position on stage, 1.3s behind stage winner OGI and just 0.1s further back behind NEU. EVA took fourth on stage, 2.7s behind the stage winner in a time of 726.4s . ROV took sixth on stage, 10.5s behind OGI in a time of 734.2s . SOL was in seventh on stage, 2.3s further back behind ROV . SLN was in eighth on stage, 12.9s behind OGI in a time of 736.6s and just 0.1s further behind SOL. These views provide various ways of comparing the performance of each driver to various ghost drivers: best recorded split time at each split (ultimate actuals): gives an estimate of how well the driver’s split times compare with each first ranked split time (time into stage at each split); fastest time going from one split to the next (ultimate sections): gives an estimate of how quickly each driver completed each split section relative to the quickest time recorded completing that split section (time taken to go from one split point to the next); accumulated ultimate sections times: gives and estimate of how quickly the driver is going relative to the fastest possible completion of the stage based on accumulated ultimate split section times. 14.1.6.1 Ultimate Actuals Driver times to various ultimate stage time calculations. These views provide various ways of comparing the performance of each driver to various ghost drivers: best recorded split time at each split (ultimate actuals): gives an estimate of how well the driver’s split times compare with each first ranked split time (time into stage at each split); fastest time going from one split to the next (ultimate sections): gives an estimate of how quickly each driver completed each split section relative to the quickest time recorded completing that split section (time taken to go from one split point to the next); accumulated ultimate sections times: gives and estimate of how quickly the driver is going relative to the fastest possible completion of the stage based on accumulated ultimate split section times. 15.1.6.1 Ultimate Actuals Driver times These views provide various ways of comparing the performance of each driver to various ghost drivers: best recorded split time at each split (ultimate actuals): gives an estimate of how well the driver’s split times compare with each first ranked split time (time into stage at each split); fastest time going from one split to the next (ultimate sections): gives an estimate of how quickly each driver completed each split section relative to the quickest time recorded completing that split section (time taken to go from one split point to the next); accumulated ultimate sections times: gives and estimate of how quickly the driver is going relative to the fastest possible completion of the stage based on accumulated ultimate split section times. 16.1.6.1 Ultimate Actuals Driver times OGI took second on stage, with a time of 303.1s and just 0.7s further behind SOR. NEU took third on stage, with a time of 304.7s kept hold of the overall lead of the rally.
